intro: Helianthella latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf helianthella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, and the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Helianthella latifolia is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
